SEARCH
Package server.Model

Class CommonGoal

java.lang.Object
server.Model.CommonGoal
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class CommonGoal extends Object implements Serializable
This Class represents the single CommonGoal card as written in the game rules. The CommonGoal cards give points to the Player that completes the schemes illustrated on the single cards. Every CommonGoal possesses a number of token (from a minimum of 2 to a maximum of 4) depending on the number of Players in the match. Every token has its score which is added to the point total of the Player that completes the CommonGoal depending on the number of Players that already completed it. Have a look at MyShelfie RuleBook for further information

    • setTokens

      public void setTokens(int playersNumber)
      This method sets the tokens for a specific CommonGoal. Depending on the playersNumber the procedure to assign the tokens to a CommonGoal is the following: (1) if there are 2 Players then 2 tokens are assigned to the CommonGoal and their score will respectively be of 8 and 4 points; (2) if there are 3 Players then 3 tokens are assigned to the CommonGoal and their score will respectively be of 8, 6 and 4 points; (3) if there are 4 Players then 4 tokens are assigned to the CommonGoal and their score will respectively be of 8, 6, 4 and 2 points;
      Parameters:
      playersNumber - the number of Players in the match
